title: A1 RNA-Seq T21 blood cells
characteristics_ch1.1: tissue: Blood cells (buffy coat and red blood cells)
treatment_protocol_ch1: Blood samples from T21 and normal control recruited donors were collected in ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA)-coated blood collection tubes, kept at room temperature and treated within two hours from blood collection. Each sample was transferred into a new tube, and plasma fraction was isolated by centrifugation at 1200 g for 10 min, while 5 mL of denaturing solution was added to the remaining blood fraction including the red blood cells and all the buffy coat, and stored at -20°C until RNA extraction.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA extraction was performed with the method of Chomczynski and Sacchi. One or if necessary two purification steps were performed using RNA Clean & Concentrator-5 Kit in order to remove possible genomic DNA contamination and to reach the minimum concentration of 50 ng/μL.
extract_protocol_ch1.1: TruSeq Stranded Total RNA with Ribo-Zero Gold (Illumina, San Diego, CA) was used for library preparation following the manufacturer's instructions, starting with 200 ng of RNA as input.
data_processing: The CASAVA 1.8.2 version of the Illumina pipeline was used to processed raw data for both format conversion and de-multiplexing.

geo_accession: Raw sequencing data were processed with BBDuk (https://jgi.doe.gov/data-and-tools/bbtools/) in order to perform trimming and clipping. Bases with a quality score less than 25 were removed as well as reads shorten than 35 nucleotides. The quality of the reads, before and after trimming, was checked with the software FASTQC (https://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/).

High-quality reads were mapped against the GRCh38 human reference genome, downloaded from Ensembl (Cunningham et al., 2019), with the software STAR (version 2.5.2b, https://github.com/alexdobin/STAR). Read summarisation was performed with featureCounts (http://subread.sourceforge.net/), only reads with a mapping quality higher than 30 were used for this scope.

The option -s 2 was used to indicate that the libraries are strand-specific. The resulting table was imported in R, and the package edgeR (https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/edgeR.html) was used to calculate fragments per kilobase million (FPKM) values.
Genome_build: GRCh38 (hg38)
Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab-delimited text files include FPKM values for each sample
Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Matrix table with raw gene counts for every gene and every sample
type: Department of Experimental, Diagnostic and Specialty Medicine
data_processing.2: Blood cells (buffy coat and red blood cells)
